teaching.topicContent: Introduce the concept of the 'one-armed robot' family: 'n,' 'm,' 'h,' 'k,' 'b,' 'p,' and 'r.' Explain that each letter in this family shares a similar one-armed formation.  Discuss the importance of consistent size, shape, and connections.
Review the cursive handwriting basics learned in previous years.Explain that students will now focus on mastering the 'one-armed robot' family. Discuss the benefits of continuous cursive writing.
Introduce the cursive formation of the letter 'n.'Demonstrate the proper starting and finishing points.Guide students in practicing the formation of 'n' independently.
Continue practicing the formation of the letter 'n.' Provide exercises that focus on consistent size and proper alignment.Discuss the diagonal flicks that will lead to joining.
Review the height and alignment of the letter 'n.'Ensure the letter is consistently formed between the baseline and midline.Practice forming 'n' with diagonal flicks in various contexts.
Introduce the concept of joining the letter 'n' to other letters. Focus on diagonal joins to letters like 'i' and 'y.'Emphasize accuracy and smooth connections.
Continue practicing joining 'n' to diagonal letters. Include letters 'o,' 'a,' and 'd' in the joining exercises. Guide students in reversing hand movements for proper formation.

teaching.topicTitle: Speed and Legibility with Joined 'n' Family Letters
teaching.topicContent: Discuss the balance between writing speed and legibility.Encourage students to practice joined 'n' family letters with increasing speed.Emphasize the importance of maintaining clear and readable writing.
Introduce the formation of the cursive letter 'm.'Highlight the unique features of the letter 'm.'Guide students in practicing the formation of 'm' in isolation.

Continue practicing the formation of the letter 'm.'Focus on proper start and end points, as well as maintaining consistent size. Provide opportunities for students to trace and write 'm' independently.

Introduce the formation of the cursive letter 'h.'  Discuss the characteristics of the letter 'h' within the 'One-Armed Robot' family.   Engage students in discussions about words that start with the letter 'h.'
Guide students in practicing the formation of the letter 'h.' Emphasize the importance of proper start and end points. Provide opportunities for students to practice writing 'h' in isolation.
Continue practicing the formation of the letter 'h.'Focus on maintaining consistent size and proper alignment.Provide exercises that incorporate 'h' within words and phrases.
Introduce the formation of the cursive letter 'k.' Discuss the unique features of the letter 'k' within the 'One-Armed Robot' family.Encourage students to identify words that contain the letter 'k.'
Guide students in practicing the formation of the letter 'k.' Emphasize the diagonal connection and proper shape of 'k.'Provide opportunities for students to trace and write 'k' independently.
Continue practicing the formation of the letter 'k.'Include exercises that involve joining 'k' to other letters. Discuss words and phrases that feature the letter 'k.'

Introduce the formation of the cursive letters 'b' and 'p.' Compare the characteristics of 'b' and 'p' within the 'One-Armed Robot' family. Engage students in discussions about words that include these letters..

Guide students in practicing the formation of the letters 'b' and 'p.'Focus on proper shape, alignment, and connections.Provide opportunities for students to practice writing 'b' and 'p' in isolation.

Continue practicing the formation of the letters 'b' and 'p.' Include exercises that involve joining 'b' and 'p' to other letters.  Discuss words, phrases, and sentences that incorporate 'b' and 'p.'.
Introduce the formation of the cursive letter 'r.' Discuss the unique features of the letter 'r' within the 'One-Armed Robot' family. Encourage students to identify words that contain the letter 'r.'
Guide students in practicing the formation of the letter 'r.'  Emphasize the curved shape and proper connections. Provide opportunities for students to trace and write 'r' independently.
Continue practicing the formation of the letter 'r.'Include exercises that involve joining 'r' to other letters.Discuss words and phrases that feature the letter 'r.'

test.description: Put your Phonics and letter sound knowledge to the test.
